thread.title: Tom Brady's still-missing jersey worth $500K, Houston cops say
thread.title_full: Tom Brady's still-missing jersey worth $500K, Houston cops say

author: Bob Hille (Bob.Hille@performgroup.com)
title: Tom Brady's still-missing jersey worth $500K, Houston cops say
text:
February 21, 2017 11:59am EST February 21, 2017 11:59am EST American Football, News, English, Tom Brady, NFL, New England Patriots According to the Houston Police report, the alleged crime is considered a first-degree felony. New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady (Getty Images) 
Updated at 11:59 a.m. ET 
Updated at 11:59 a.m. ET 
Tom Brady's Super Bowl jersey is still missing in what could be a $500,000 heist. 
The No. 12 jersey, presumed stolen since it went missing from his locker at NRG Stadium in Houston after the Patriots' win Feb. 5 over the Falcons, is valued at half a million dollars, according to a Houston Police Department report ( via the Houston Chronicle ). 
MORE: NFL trade rumors: Jimmy Garoppolo 'can't completely' ignore speculation 
Petty theft, this ain't. 
In fact, according to the police report, the alleged crime is considered a first-degree felony and the Police Impersonation and Swindle squads of the Houston PD's Major Offenders Division are handling the case. 
The summary on the police report states: "On 2/05/17, the City of Houston hosted Super Bowl LI in the NRG Stadium. Shortly after winning the game, New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady noticed his game jersey missing from his locker in the Patriots designated locker room." 
Brady, the game's MVP, was visibly upset about the missing jersey after the game. Read This
